text: Prepare all of the ingredients in advance. This will help with organization and reduces time wasted on looking for ingredients. Measure out the flour first.  Add yeast to the flour.  Add the salt and mix into the flour. Add the sugar. Mix in the olive oil and the tomatoes. Use your hands if you want to mix it well. Keep combining the dough until you end up with no flour left at the bottom of the bowl. It should look like this. Leave dough to rest in a warm place until it rises. 20-mins Put the dough in cellophane.  Cut the dough once lengthwise then 4 times crosswise. You should end up with something that looks like this. Break apart the 8 dough slices and form balls. Press the balls down slightly and cover with a damp towel for 20 minutes Put in an oven at 40 °C (104 °F) for 20 minutes to let the dough rise.  Once the 20 minutes is up, take the dough out of the oven and turn the oven up to 140 degrees C  Re-dust the dough and put back in the oven.  Take it out of the oven. Allow it to cool for 10 minutes and serve. Finished.
